title: Longhorn901
author: Longhorn901
created_time: May 18, 2023, 06:20:22 AMLast edit: June 22, 2023, 02:56:22 AM by Longhorn901
content: Hello Everyone!We're excited to introduce you to a unique project that's been quietly growing since 2017: Tribe.Tribe is a cryptocurrency on its own POW/Masternode blockchain, we are bringing together the worlds of AI and crypto in a way that's never been done before. The Tribe blockchain incorporates a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) directly in its source code. This DAO has the potential to play a fundamental role in our new project.The most exciting part? We're looking to incorporate AI into our DAO, creating a truly groundbreaking blend of cutting-edge technology and decentralized governance. This fusion of AI and blockchain has the potential to push the boundaries of what's possible in the crypto space, opening up a world of opportunities.Despite running for several years, the DAO feature within Tribe has yet to be fully implemented and tested. This is where you come in. We're seeking curious minds who are interested in AI and crypto to join our journey. Whether you're a developer, a crypto enthusiast, an AI expert, or someone who's simply interested in being part of a pioneering project, we'd love to have you on board.Currently, we are in the very early stages of this project, exploring potential use cases for our AI-driven DAO. By joining us, you'll have the opportunity to contribute ideas, provide input on the project's direction, and help shape the future of Tribe.This is a chance to be part of something special, an opportunity to pioneer a new path in the rapidly evolving intersection of AI, crypto, and decentralized governance. If you have a passion for these areas, we'd be thrilled to welcome you to our community.Join our Discord and become part of the Tribe!LinksDiscord: https://discord.gg/BzSeuGsLooking forward to pioneering the future together!P.S. We're also considering a rebranding in the near future, so you'll have the chance to be part of that exciting process too!

comments.author: Longhorn901
comments.body: This will be the first of regular updates and we have some exciting updates to share with you all today.First up, a big shout out to @T.A, who has added Tribe to his mining pool https://mine.altcoinbuilders.com/. This is a fantastic opportunity for all of us. If you've been looking for a way to support Tribe and contribute to the network, this is it! By pointing your miner to his pool, you'll be able to mine Tribe and contribute to the security and decentralization of our blockchain.Also, we're thrilled to announce that we now have our own explorer! Check it out at http://explorer.tribecrypto.net:3001/. This tool is crucial for transparency and insight into the Tribe blockchain. You can view transactions, blocks, and other pertinent details about the network there.Lastly, we have some good news for those who have been experiencing syncing issues with their wallets. We've set up a DNS seeder, which should make the syncing process much smoother and faster.Remember, we're all in this together, shaping the future of Tribe. Every bit of mining, every transaction, and every bit of feedback helps us grow stronger. Let's keep the momentum going, Tribe! üöÄHappy mining, everyone!

comments.author: Longhorn901
comments.body: Hello Tribe community! üöÄWe are excited to announce an innovative development on the horizon for Tribe. We are diving into an ambitious project that involves integrating Tribe with an established open-source satellite infrastructure.This project, which already boasts a constellation of deployed cubesats, presents a unique and revolutionary opportunity. We plan to utilize this system for short message data transfers between our nodes and the blockchain. Imagine our network having the capability of communicating, not just through terrestrial internet but via satellites orbiting our Earth! üåêThis development is groundbreaking within the crypto world. To our knowledge, no other crypto project is currently harnessing the potential of satellite infrastructure in such a direct and practical way. This could give us an edge in terms of security, global reach, and network resilience.We believe this innovation aligns perfectly with Tribe's mission of constantly pushing boundaries while enhancing privacy, security, and efficiency of transactions.It's a brave new world we're stepping into, and we're thrilled to have you on this journey with us. Stay tuned for more updates as we make progress in this exciting venture.Together, let's take Tribe beyond the stratosphere! üõ∞Ô∏èKeep up the good work everyone! üí™

comments.author: Longhorn901
comments.body: Tribe Project Successfully Integrates Satellite Telemetry Data with BlockchainHello Tribe Community,We are thrilled to announce a significant milestone in the Tribe project. For the first time, we have successfully integrated satellite telemetry data with our blockchain. This achievement marks a crucial step in our ongoing efforts to incorporate open-source satellite project infrastructure into Tribe.In this proof-of-concept, we've created a system that receives telemetry data from a satellite, encodes it, and includes it in a Tribe blockchain transaction using an OP_RETURN output. This transaction has been successfully broadcasted and confirmed on the Tribe network.This is a revolutionary advancement that sets Tribe apart in the blockchain and cryptocurrency world. By integrating satellite technology into our network, we're not only enhancing the user experience but also paving the way for a host of exciting features and applications.But we're not stopping here. This is just the first of many exciting developments to come as we continue to explore the potential of this technology.To celebrate this milestone, we're launching a contest with a prize of 50 TRB for the first person who can locate this satellite data on the Tribe blockchain. The data is included in an OP_RETURN output of a transaction that has been recently confirmed.To participate, you'll need to find the transaction, decode the OP_RETURN output, and post the decoded data in the discord. The first person to do so will win the prize.We're excited to see who will be the first to find the data. Good luck to all participants!Stay tuned for more updates as we continue to push the boundaries of what's possible with Tribe and blockchain technology.

comments.author: Longhorn901
comments.created_time: June 22, 2023, 02:42:14 AMLast edit: June 22, 2023, 02:54:32 AM by Longhorn901
comments.body: Tribe Blockchain - Expanding Horizons with Satellite Data IntegrationHello Bitcointalk community,We're back with another exciting update from the Tribe project. As you may already know, we've achieved a significant milestone by successfully incorporating satellite data onto the Tribe blockchain. This unique integration has been a game-changer, and we're thrilled to see the potential it holds for future applications.Despite the enthusiasm around this development, it seems we didn't have a winner for our recent contest. However, we'd like to take this opportunity to delve deeper into how this integration works, using one of our latest transactions as an example.Here is the TRB transaction ID: ee3f26a9b4b024941f945b4b4a6ada826f88fd6bddd8cf91effe6b93a96967a0To view the satellite data, follow these steps:1. Visit the Tribe explorer enter the TXID and on the next page click on the round info icon to the right of the transaction ID.2. Scroll down to the "scriptPubKey" section.3. Look for the line that starts with "OP_RETURN". The string of numbers following "OP_RETURN" is the satellite data in hexadecimal format.For example, you might see something like this:"scriptPubKey": {¬†¬† ¬†"asm": "OP_RETURN 547269626563727970746f5f6e65742c5341544c4c412d32422c4c6f52612c3433372e32352c313 02c352c36322e35302c31333a30353a30382c2d3133332e30302c2d31322e3030",}You can convert this hexadecimal string to ASCII to see the actual satellite data.These transactions are easy to spot - most of them are only about 0.002 TRB.We're just scratching the surface of what's possible with Tribe. As we continue to innovate and push the boundaries, we look forward to sharing more updates with you. Stay tuned!Best,The Tribe Team

comments.author: Longhorn901
comments.created_time: June 23, 2023, 02:43:00 PMLast edit: June 23, 2023, 03:24:12 PM by Longhorn901
comments.body: Quote from: zsky on June 23, 2023, 07:24:13 AMsatellite?What is his specific role?please informThere seems to be some question as to what exactly are we doing, here's a deeper dive into our exciting project!At present, we're in an experimental phase, closely monitoring several low earth orbit CubeSats. As these satellites pass overhead, we're capturing some of their telemetry data and logging it onto the Tribe blockchain. This is a significant step forward, as it's the first time we've successfully integrated satellite data into our blockchain. üõ∞Ô∏èBut this is just the beginning. Our vision for the future is much broader. One of the main use cases we're working towards is enabling IoT and M2M micropayments for remote devices. Imagine a remote weather station or a wildlife tracking device in a location with no traditional internet connectivity. With our system, these devices could send their data via passing satellites, and the data could be logged onto the Tribe blockchain. This could enable micropayments for data transactions, opening up new possibilities for data monetization and resource allocation.We're excited about the potential of this technology and are working hard to make this vision a reality. Stay tuned for more updates as we continue to innovate and push the boundaries of what's possible with Tribe. The future is truly in the stars! üåüThis also opens up many other use cases, here are a few ideas,¬†**Wildlife Tracking**: Tracking devices on wildlife could record location data and other information, which could then be sent to the satellite network and recorded on the Tribe blockchain. This would provide a secure, tamper-proof record of wildlife movements, which could be invaluable for conservation efforts.**Remote Infrastructure Monitoring**: Infrastructure in remote areas, such as pipelines, power lines, or roads, could be monitored using sensors. Any significant events or changes could be recorded on the Tribe blockchain, providing a reliable record that could aid in maintenance and repair efforts.**Emergency Alerts**: In areas with limited connectivity, the Tribe blockchain could be used to send emergency alerts. For example, a remote weather station could detect a coming storm and broadcast an alert via the satellite network. This alert could be recorded on the Tribe blockchain, providing a verifiable record of the alert.**Remote Health Monitoring**: Health data from patients in remote areas could be recorded on the Tribe blockchain. This could provide a secure, tamper-proof record of the patient's health over time, which could be invaluable for remote healthcare services.**Agricultural Data Collection**: In remote farming areas, data about soil conditions, weather, crop growth, etc., could be collected and sent to the satellite network, which then gets recorded on the Tribe blockchain. This could help in monitoring crop health, planning harvests, and predicting yields.**Location Stamping**: For devices or assets that are being tracked via satellite, a hash of their location data could be stored on the Tribe blockchain at regular intervals. This would provide a tamper-proof record of the asset's location over time.**Short Message Service**: The Tribe blockchain could be used to send short, secure messages. This could be useful in a variety of applications, such as secure communication between devices in an IoT network.

comments.author: Longhorn901
comments.body: Why incorporate satellite data into the Tribe blockchain?At Tribe, we're working on an innovative system that leverages the capabilities of Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellites to enable data transmission from remote locations, particularly for Internet of Things (IoT) and Machine-to-Machine (M2M) devices.Our focus is not on providing continuous global coverage like systems such as Starlink, but rather on creating a network that can handle intermittent data transmission. As long as there are multiple satellite passes per day, our system can effectively serve its purpose.The key advantage of using LEO satellites in our system is their accessibility for low-power devices. These devices can directly upload data to the satellites using a simple antenna, without the need for expensive transmitters and/or dish installations. This makes our system practical and cost-effective for remote IoT and M2M applications.Our system essentially functions as a store-and-forward mechanism. When a satellite passes overhead, devices transmit their data, which is then stored on the satellite. The satellite subsequently forwards the data to a ground station when it comes into range. This data is then logged onto the Tribe blockchain, providing a secure and immutable record of the data transmission.Furthermore, we're exploring the potential of integrating a micropayment system into this network. This could enable devices to make small payments for the data they transmit, opening up new possibilities for data monetization and resource allocation.We're also considering the concept of a Super Masternode with direct satellite connectivity. This could provide valuable services and functionality within the constraints of the 160-byte limit for the transactions on the Tribe blockchain.In summary, we're building a system that leverages the unique advantages of LEO satellites to enable data transmission from remote locations, with potential applications in IoT and M2M communications. While it may not offer continuous global coverage, it serves the specific purpose of facilitating communication between devices in remote locations, and holds significant potential for future advancements.

comments.author: Longhorn901
comments.body: üöÄ New Development Update: Satellite Data Discord Bot üöÄHello Tribe community! We're excited to share our latest development with you. We've been working hard behind the scenes and are proud to announce the deployment of our new Discord bot!This bot is not just any bot - it's designed to fetch and post satellite data directly into our Discord channel. This is a significant step forward in our ongoing efforts to integrate open-source satellite project infrastructure into Tribe.Here's a brief overview of what we've accomplished:Data Fetching: The bot fetches the latest satellite data from a file that is updated with new data from our CubeSats. This data is in hexadecimal format.Data Processing: The bot then converts this hexadecimal data into ASCII, providing us with readable information about our satellite network. This includes details like the ground station, satellite, modulation, frequency, spreading factor, coding rate, bandwidth, received time, signal RSSI, and signal SNR.Data Posting: The bot posts this processed data to our 'satellite-feed' Discord channel every 60 seconds. This allows us to monitor the status of our satellites in real-time.Data Comparison: To avoid spamming the channel with redundant information, the bot only posts new data if it's different from the last sent data. This ensures that we're always kept up-to-date with the latest changes in our satellite network.We believe this bot will greatly enhance our ability to monitor and manage our satellite network, and we're excited to see it in action. As always, we're committed to pushing the boundaries of what's possible with Tribe, and we're grateful for your continued support as we embark on this exciting journey.Stay tuned for more updates, and as always, feel free to reach out if you have any questions or feedback!

comments.author: Longhorn901
comments.body: üéâ Exciting news, Tribe community! üéâWe've taken a significant step towards ensuring the longevity and resilience of the Tribe blockchain with the introduction of our solar-powered AtomicPi miner. This unique setup, which we like to think of as our very own land-based Tribe mining satellite, is designed to keep the Tribe blockchain alive and kicking, even in the event that no other miners are active.Here's how it works: The heart of the system is an AtomicPi, a compact yet powerful single-board computer, running our Tribe wallet on Linux. This little powerhouse is responsible for the actual mining work, crunching the numbers to find new blocks and keep the blockchain moving.But what makes this setup truly special is its energy source. The AtomicPi is powered entirely by solar energy, harvested by a 360-watt solar panel. The energy collected by the panel is managed by a solar charge controller, which ensures the system operates efficiently and safely. The power is stored in two Trojan 6 volt T105 batteries, providing a reliable source of energy for the AtomicPi.The entire system is regulated by a voltage regulator, ensuring the AtomicPi receives a steady and safe supply of power. This means our miner can keep working around the clock, regardless of the weather or time of day.While the mining speed of this setup may not match that of larger, grid-powered mining rigs, its true value lies in its resilience. As long as the sun keeps shining, our solar-powered miner will keep working on the Tribe blockchain. This ensures that even if all other miners were to stop, the Tribe blockchain would live on.This is just one of the innovative ways we're working to secure the future of Tribe. Stay tuned for more exciting updates! üí™üöÄ
